title: Resuming the United States Refugee Admissions Program With Enhanced Vetting Capabilities

enrichment.summary: This executive order lifts a temporary suspension on the U.S. Refugee Admissions Program (USRAP) with new and enhanced screening and vetting procedures to better protect national security. It directs relevant agencies to continue monitoring risks posed by certain refugee categories and requires periodic assessments and reports on the programâ€™s impact on U.S. safety.
potential_concerns: Enhanced vetting procedures may delay or reduce refugee admissions, negatively impacting vulnerable refugees awaiting resettlement.

The emphasis on national security and counterterrorism could lead to disproportionate scrutiny or restrictions on refugee applicants from certain countries, potentially violating principles of fairness.

Ongoing risk assessments may result in the suspension or modification of refugee admissions from specific countries, directly affecting citizens-of-specific-countries-by-eo-designation and limiting their access to refuge.
Interagency coordination and intelligence-sharing enhancements might raise privacy concerns or lead to errors that unjustifiably deny refugee status to eligible applicants.
